to choke off funding for his rival Laurent Gbagbo. As Nigeria called on the UN Security Council to authorise force to prise Gbagbo out of the presidency, Alassane Ouattara 's government flexed its muscles by insisting on the immediate stoppage of all exports of coffee and cocoa . Producers and exporters who violate the ban would be considered to be`` financing the illegitimate regime'' of Gbagbo, said an edict from his office signed by his prime minister Guillaume Soro.
